title: How are computers half alive? - Quora

response.answer_text: User-10697664547469613574 has a perfectly good answer which Quora has collapsed, presumably because it is too short. I will spend more words saying the same thing. Look at how I use these words Quora, I’ll bet you’re pleased. Anyway. Computers are not half alive. They are electrical devices, just like a microwave, or even a light bulb. There is no life, just electricity. They are machines, no life.

There is a legend that computers are ‘electronic brains’ and those who run them are ‘supermen’ . But the truth is computers are very stupid and the people who programme them are normal human beings. It is very misleading to imagine that computers can ‘think’ like people. They cannot. However theyvmake it possible for people to ‘bottle’ thought. You work out how to solve a problem. Write a program and computer will apply your thinking to that problem as long and often as you like. In this sense computers are half alive because they perpetuate the thinking of their creators.
